questions.text: In The Serpent’s Secret by Sayantani DasGupta, who is Neel’s sister?

is gym class described as a school-approved body-shaming session?
does a character’s brother pay her twenty bucks in cash to take a public bus home from school?
do characters hear a tornado siren before finding out a tornado hit the next town and is spinning toward them?

does a character apologize for not being a good sister and make a promise to start doing better?

what are the first names of Enemy Number 1 and Enemy Number 2?
what is the name of the school librarian?
Ellie’s dad has three rules for her when he takes her shopping for clothes. Name two of them.
questions.answer: 1) enjoy, (2) no limits, (3) take your time

questions.text: what does zaftig mean?
Ellie gives three secret hiding places where she stashes food in her room? Name two of them.
questions.answer: 1) in the ripped-open side of a stuffed animal, (2) in the pockets of an old backpack, and (3) in a hollowed-out book

questions.text: what does Dr. Wood use to get Ellie to start talking to her?

what does Ellie’s therapist throw to her to engage her in a duel so she’ll start opening up?

questions.answer: The memory card to their camera

questions.text: what is the name of the teacher who asks Ellie to be a student assistant in the library?

what does Ellie burn to symbolize letting go and starting over?
what do the mean girls who bully Ellie want her to eat as ransom to get her dog back?
what does Ellie hand her mother after confronting her in her therapist’s office?
questions.answer: A notebook full of all the ugly (or mean) words that her mom has ever said to her

questions.answer: Biodrones confirmed the atmosphere has sufficient oxygen

questions.text: does a boy survive the streets of north korea after his family is exiled?
does the protagonist lead a gang of boys to survive by stealing and scavenging?
does the author join his friend to care for her grandmother in return for shelter when he has nowhere else to go?
does the main character’s mother leave the family home to go find food to sell?
does a boy wake up on the streets next to his friend, only to find that he had died in his sleep during the night?
does the protagonist form a close bond with other homeless boys, living in a fishing shed?
does the author steal from government farms and sell the produce to the merchants?
do police kill a man accused of treason?
does the main character think his friend is joking around about eating squirrel?
is the main character told by his friend that he will be going to watch an execution of someone who committed crimes?
does the main character perform 'we are kid scouts' with his friends on the street to get money for food?
does the main character look for a rock somewhere near a river that the locals say brings good fortune?
does a boy pretend not to be related to his grandmother in fear he would be captured?
does the main character go looking for his father even though he risks committing treason?
does the main character look back at all that was happening to him in disbelief for hours, trying to make sense of it all?
does the main character befriend a boy who sings at the train station to earn money for his family?
how does the main character realize his home had been invaded?
questions.answer: He came home from school to find his family’s apartment empty

questions.text: why is it so difficult for someone to escape from North Korea into South Korea?
questions.answer: The border between them is full of explosive mine (p. xii

questions.text: why do people in North Korea believe that Kim Jong is without fault?
questions.answer: The TV and news are controlled by the government and only report the good things about him

questions.text: what effect do books, file, radio and TV shows have on North Korea?
questions.answer: They start to distrust Westerners like the US, China and Japan and looked at their leader like a god

questions.text: what does Sungju have that his father carved and painted for him?
what role does Sungju’s mother play when they reenact Kim Jong’s battles?
what TV show does Sungju Lee like to watch as he plays with toy soldiers?
how is Sungju reunited with his family?
questions.answer: His grandfather finds him at the train station

questions.text: what does Sungju’s grandfather do for work?
what does Sungju’s mother do for work?
questions.answer: She works on a government farm

questions.text: what is Sungju’s job as school captain?
questions.answer: To ensure that the entire student body stood in straight lines and at attention, saluting the national flag of Joseon, followed by pledging allegiance that they would always be prepared to fight for their country

questions.text: why do people start stealing so much in Joseon?
why does the town of Shang-gi-ryeong look to have a slate film covering everything, visible even at night?
what do Sungju and his friends do to Young-bum’s house to try and keep the brokers away while they’re gone?
questions.answer: They nail planks of wood across the doors and windows in hopes that it would like as if it were falling down

questions.text: does Sungju ever go back to his home to see if he can find his parents?
questions.answer: Yes, but the person living there would not talk with him and told him to go away

questions.text: why does Sungju trade his books for food like tofu, cabbage, and corn oil?
questions.answer: His family and entire community are starving due to the government taking over
